## Constitution Compliance

- [ ] CHK001 Spec-First: Feature behavior defined before implementation
- [ ] CHK002 Schema-Driven: Required JSON schemas created/updated
- [ ] CHK003 Privacy: TLS 1.2+ enforced; E2E encryption handled correctly
- [ ] CHK004 Transport Agnostic: Message semantics identical across transports
- [ ] CHK005 Interoperability: JSON-RPC 2.0 compliant; A2A/MCP considered
- [ ] CHK006 Component Separation: No boundary violations (Adapter/Hub/Agent)
- [ ] CHK007 Reliable Delivery: At-least-once semantics maintained
- [ ] CHK008 Adapter Resilience: Local queuing/persistence working
- [ ] CHK009 Semantic Versioning: Version bump appropriate for change type
- [ ] CHK010 Graceful Degradation: Unsupported features handled gracefully

## TDD & Coverage (Principle XI)

- [ ] CHK011 Tests written BEFORE implementation code
- [ ] CHK012 Tests failed before implementation (Red phase verified)
- [ ] CHK013 All tests passing (Green phase complete)
- [ ] CHK014 Code refactored while maintaining green tests
- [ ] CHK015 Coverage report generated
- [ ] CHK016 Coverage meets 95% threshold
- [ ] CHK017 Unit tests cover individual functions/modules
- [ ] CHK018 Integration tests cover cross-module interactions
- [ ] CHK019 Contract tests validate schema compliance

## Schema Validation

- [ ] CHK020 signal.schema.json validates all signal messages
- [ ] CHK021 action.schema.json validates all action messages
- [ ] CHK022 jsonrpc.schema.json validates wire format
- [ ] CHK023 errors.schema.json covers all error codes
- [ ] CHK024 Method schemas validate pub/sub operations
- [ ] CHK025 Schema examples match spec documentation
